name: Detecting Social Engineering Attacks
description: Recognizing and neutralizing social engineering tactics used for psychological manipulation and cyber infiltration.

cards.title: Recognizing Common Social Engineering Techniques
cards.description: Understanding the most frequently used methods to manipulate targets into revealing sensitive information.
bulletpoints: Identifying phishing, pretexting, and baiting strategies.
Understanding human psychology in cyber attacks.
Analyzing real-world social engineering case studies.
cards.summaryText: Surveys phishing, pretexting, and baiting plays while tying them to psychological levers exposed in case studies.

cards.title: Counteracting Psychological Manipulation
cards.description: Developing mental resilience against deception, coercion, and fear-based tactics.
cards.summaryText: Focuses on spotting biases, staying hyper-aware, and verifying channels to blunt manipulative outreach.

cards.title: Exposing Social Engineering Networks
cards.description: Tracking and identifying large-scale social engineering operations and their operators.
bulletpoints: Mapping out deceptive digital influence campaigns.
Investigating cyber-crime syndicates leveraging social engineering.
Detecting AI-driven manipulation patterns in online spaces.
cards.summaryText: Explains how to chart influence webs, trace syndicate operators, and surface AI-boosted manipulation signatures.
